column1: “though not proved guilty, were reasonably suspected of being responsible…”. Learned
counsel has also cited the views of this Court in Sithamparanathan v Peoples Bank
[(1989) 1 Sri.LR 124], and Bank of Ceylon v Manivasagasivam [(1995) 2 Sri.LR 79]
in support of his position that the concept of loss of confidence applies despite lack
of proof of the guilt of an employee.
